message:
Resistor R7005 keeps blowing up..  History: Water damage

Checked all the caps and resistor around U7090.. all ok..

[ATTACH type="full" alt="Skärmbild (81).png"]59463[/ATTACH]
Post diode mode to ground at C7090/98; red probe connected to ground.

"C7090 = 0.107"
Really bad...

Remove C7090-92 one by one and check again.
If still low, replace U7090; most likely.

Thanks, Master it worked.
I removed C7090 and without the cap it shows now = 0.430
replaced with another cap on C7090, and not it shows = 0.399 and now I have a green light on the charger with my DC Supply but not normal charger.

PPBUS_G3H is now 8.1v only

I will post some voltages now for you

No Green light on the charger

PPBUS_G3H = 8.1V
SMBUS_SMC_DATA  = 3.3
SMBUS_SMC_CLK = 3.3
SMC_ADAPTER_ENABLE = 0
PP1V2_S5_SMC_VDD = 1.2
SMC_RST_L = 0  (No corrosion around J6100)
Im going to change the SMC and we see what we get... 8.1v seems like an SMC issue... I'm also missing SMC_RST_L

So I changed the SMC and now have Greenlight/ orange light on the charger(8.5v on PPBUS_G3H).  As I suspected 8.1v it's an SMC failure.
I Will post new Voltages in a bit. Checking the board now.

You should reballed it first.
Keep it in safe place and try it in a future repair.

Thanks Master... Good Point.. I should have reballed it first and then used it again..  I did though do a reflow, and nothing happened that's why I changed it.. 

Working on the board now and will post some Voltages shortly within the next few hours.

Master [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER]

Please see following
[LIST=1]
[*]SMC_RST_L = 3.3
[*]PP3V3_S5 = 3.3
[*]PM_PWRBTN_L = 3.3
[*]SMC_ON_OFF_L = 3.4
[*]PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC = 3.3
[*]PPV_RTC_RST = 3.3
[*]PP5V_S5 = 5v
[*]PM_PWRBTN = 3.3
[*]PPVRTC_G3H = 3.3
[*]PCH_INTVRMEN = 3.3
[*]PCH_SRTC_RST = 3.3
[*]PCH_DSWVRMEN = 3.3
[*]PP3V3_SUS = 3.3
[*]PM_BATLOW_L = 3.3
[*]PM_RSMT_RST = 3.3
[/LIST]

[B]Missing:[/B]
[LIST=1]
[*]PM_SLP_S5
[*]PP5VS4RS3_EN for U7501
[/LIST]

I changed the SMC again just for the sake of it, to the old one, reballed it as you said. Didn't work at all, no green light. So I have now changed back to another SMC and have green light again with these voltages above

feeling that PCH is broken and not outputting PM_SLP_S4
I don't see PCH_INTRUDER_L listed there...

[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 65941, member: 682"]
I don't see PCH_INTRUDER_L listed there...
[/QUOTE]

PCH_INTRUDER_L  = 3.3v ON Pin 1 and output Pin 2 to PCh = 2.4v

Post SMC_ONOFF_L and PM_RSMRST_L.
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L at same time.
If present, all PM_SLP_Sx_L signals should pulse too; check that.

SMC_ONOFF_L = 3.3
PM_RSMRST_L  = 3.3

[I]Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L at same time.   [/I]Its not possible, the board is on two sides..  How?

"Its not possible..." :eek:
Use R5115/16 pads...

Thanks [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER] I learned something new there with R5115/16

I triggered SMC_ON_OFF_L  3.3v - 0v - 3.3v.. Still nothing... What's next you suggest?

On the Y1905 clock chip I get 50 mhz.. is that correct value? Shouldn't it be 25Mhz.
So PM_PWRBTN_L doesn't drop at same time with SMC_ONOFF_L?
Yes, it drops to 335.0mv
Then check if any PM_SLP_Sx_L signal pulses at same time.
